'''Findobar''' was the son of [[Fingon#Other versions of the legendarium|Fingon]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] from a genealogical table created by [[Tolkien]] in the early 1930s.<ref>{{LR|A1}}, p. 451</ref>

The table has not been published but [[Christopher Tolkien]] mentioned the name in his comments on the genealogies of the ''[[Quenta Noldorinwa]]'' period in the Appendix to ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]''.<ref>{{LR|A1}}, p. 403</ref>

In the later versions of ''[[The Silmarillion]]'' the character of Findobar was discarded from the legendarium.

== Etymology ==
''Findobar'' was a [[Noldorin]] name appearing as a compound of ''[[phinde]]'' ("skill"), and ''[[bár]]'' ("home; earth").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-1798790755.html|articlename=N. ''Findobar'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=26 August 2022}}</ref>
